An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to extinguish the fire. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't catch fire.

action.name: Tangleweb
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20 ft., one creature. {@h}The creature must succeed on a {@dc 11} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by sticky web-like adhesive. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 11} Strength check, escaping from the tangleweb on a success. The effect ends if the tangleweb is destroyed. The tangleweb has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

Each gnoll ally that is within 30 feet of it, can hear it, and not already affected by Yeenoghu's Howl gain advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points until the start of the gnoll's next turn.

entries: The gnoll magically polymorphs into a giant hyena, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The gnoll has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the gnoll's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Packmaster
entries: A allied gnoll that starts its turn within 30 feet of this gnoll and that can see and hear this gnoll gains Pack Tactics until the start of its next turn.

entries: If the gnoll moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a greataxe attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the gnoll can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) danni da percosse.

entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} per colpire, portata 150/600 ft., una creatura. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Battlefeld Cunning {@recharge 4}
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet of the gnoll that can hear it can use their reactions to make one melee attack each.

trait.name: Go for the Throat
entries: As a bonus action, the gnoll targets one hyena within 30 feet that can see and hear the gnoll. The hyena can use its reaction to move up to half its speed and make one melee attack against a {@condition prone} creature. If the hyena hits, the hit is automatically a critical hit.

trait.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The gnoll deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Summon Hyenas (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the gnoll summons {@dice 1d4 + 1} hyenas. The hyenas appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the gnoll and acts as its allies. The hyenas act right after the gnoll on the same initiative count and fght until they're destroyed. They disappear when the gnoll dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gnoll makes two attacks, either with its glaive or its longbow. It can replace one of its attacks with hunting bolas.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} per colpire, portata 150/600 ft., una creatura. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Hunting Bolas
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} per colpire, portata 20/60 ft., una creatura. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d3 + 3}) danni da percosse e il bersaglio deve riuscire in un tiro salvezza di Forza {@dc 13} o essere {@condition restrained} e colpito {@condition prone}. Come azione, la creatura {@condition restrained} può effettuare una prova di Forza {@dc 13} e fuggire in caso di successo. L'effetto termina se il bolas da caccia viene distrutto. Il bolas da caccia ha CA 10, 5 punti ferita, resistenza ai danni da percosse e immunità ai danni da veleno e psichici.

trait.name: Aberrant Ground
entries: The ground in a 15-foot radius around the horror is doughlike difficult terrain. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Gibbering
entries: The horror babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn't {@condition incapacitated}. Each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the horror and can hear the gibbering must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and uses all its movement to move in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gibbering horror uses Engulf. It then makes two Pseudopod Bite attacks, and if it can, uses its Blinding Spittle.

action.name: Pseudopod Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d8 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the horror can't use the same pseudopod bite on another target. If the horror starts its turn grappling with a creature, it can use a bonus action to pull that creature within 5 feet of it.

action.name: Blinding Spittle
entries: The horror spits a chemical glob at a point it can see within 20 feet of it. The glob explodes in a blinding flash of light on impact. Each creature within 5 feet of the flash must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of the horror's next turn.

action.name: Engulf
entries: The horror moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter Medium or smaller creatures' spaces. Whenever the horror enters a creature's space, the creature must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a successful save, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the horror. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed saving throw. On a failed save, the horror enters the creature's space, and the creature takes 29 ({@damage 6d8 + 2}) piercing damage and is engulfed. While engulfed, the creature is {@condition blinded}, can't breathe, and {@condition restrained}, and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the horror's turns. lf the target is killed by this damage, it is absorbed into the horror. When the horror moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a {@dc 13} Strength check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the horror. The horror can have only up to two Medium or small creatures engulfed at a time.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The giant is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The giant can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Heart of the Storm
entries: Whenever the giant casts a spell other than a cantrip that deals lightning or thunder damage, a stormy aura surrounds it. In addition to the spell's effects, creatures of its choice within 10 feet of it take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) lightning or thunder damage (giant' choice).

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The giant has 13 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the giant casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, it can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the giant casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, it can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.
Subtle Spell: When the giant casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

The creature remains {@condition frightened} until the fire is extinguished. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to extinguish the fire. languages: any languages it knew in life

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}). The ghost can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ghost is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

trait.name: Whispering Aura
entries: At the start of each of the ghost's turns, each creature of its choice within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage, provided that the ghost isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Withering Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4 x 10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession
entries: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or profciencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.
The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

action.name: Horrifying Visage
entries: Each non-undead creature within 60 feet of the ghost that can see it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target also ages {@dice 1d4 x 10} years. A {@condition frightened} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the {@condition frightened} condition on itself on a success. If a target's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the target is immune to this ghost's Horrifying Visage for the next 24 hours. The aging effect can be reversed with a {@spell greater restoration} spell, but only within 24 hours of it occurring.

action.name: Possession
entries: One humanoid that the ghost can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw or be possessed by the ghost; the ghost then disappears, and the target is {@condition incapacitated} and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that turn undead, and it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, Charisma, and immunity to being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. It otherwise uses the possessed target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or profciencies.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the ghost ends it as a bonus action, or the ghost is turned or forced out by an effect like the dispel evil and good spell. When the possession ends, the ghost reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body.
The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the possession ends.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The ghost adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The marid can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the marid must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the marid for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the marid's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The marid can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the marid must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, the marid will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The marid can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The marid has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marid makes two trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) piercing damage, or 21 ({@dice 3d8 + 8}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The marid magically shoots water in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 30 feet away from the marid and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Trident
entries: The marid makes a trident attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Surging Waves (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The marid magically unleashes a violent wave of water that gushes forth from it in all directions. Each creature within 15 feet of the marid must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) bludgeoning damage and if the target is Huge or smaller, is pushed 15 feet and knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't pushed and knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The marid's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}). The marid can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the marid dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the marid was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The marid makes two trident attacks.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) piercing damage, or 16 ({@dice 2d8 +7}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Water Jet
entries: The marid magically shoots water in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage and, if it is Huge or smaller, is pushed up to 20 feet away from the marid and knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a target takes half the bludgeoning damage, but is neither pushed nor knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Water Spouts {@recharge 5}
entries: The marid targets up to four creatures it can see within 30 feet of it and magically creates powerful water spouts beneath them. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage, and if it is Large or smaller, is flung upward up to 30 feet. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. At the end of the turn, the water spouts end and the affected creatures fall back down (taking falling damage) and are knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and is not flung upward.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The efreeti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The efreeti can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the efreeti dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the efreeti was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and if the target is not immune to fire, it gains vulnerability to fire damage until the end of the efreeti's next turn.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Arcing Fireblade {@recharge 5}
entries: The efreeti swings its scimitar in a full arc, and every creature within 10 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and if the target is not immune to fire, it gains vulnerability to fire damage until the end of the efreeti's next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't gain vulnerability to fire damage.

reaction.name: Fiery Shield
entries: The efreeti adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the efreeti must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. If the attack misses as a result of this, the attacker takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The efreeti's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The efreeti can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the efreeti must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the efreeti for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the efreeti's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The efreeti can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the efreeti must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, the efreeti will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The efreeti can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the efreeti dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the efreeti was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The efreeti has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The efreeti makes two scimitar attacks or uses its Hurl Flame twice.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Hellfire Gaze {@recharge}
entries: The efreeti's eyes projects intense fery energy in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 4d6 + 16}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fne ash and slag. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

legendary.name: Scimitar
entries: The efreeti makes a scimitar attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The efreeti casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The efreeti magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Conflagrate (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The efreeti targets up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target that is not immune to fire must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened}, takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage, and catches fire, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage at the end of each of its turns. The creature remains {@condition frightened} until the fire is extinguished. An affected creature or another creature within 5 feet of it can take an action to extinguish the fire. On a successful save, the creature is not {@condition frightened}, takes half as much damage and doesn't catch fire.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}). The djinni can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:
will: {@spell create food and water} (can create wine instead of water)

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks. The djinni can replace one of those attacks with Spirit Away.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice).

action.name: Create Whirlwind
entries: A 5-foot-radius, 30-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.

A creature can use its action to free a creature {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a {@dc 20} Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

action.name: Spirit Away
entries: The djinni targets a nonhostile creature within 60 feet of it. Until the end of the turn, the target gains a flying speed of 40 feet and can use its reaction to move up to its flying speed without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

reaction.name: Intercept Attack
entries: In response to another creature within 5 feet of it being hit by an attack roll, the djinni gives that creature a +5 bonus to its AC against that attack, potentially causing a miss. To use this ability, the djinni must be able to see the creature and the attacker.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The djinni's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). The djinni can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:
will: {@spell create food and water} (can create wine instead of water)

trait.name: Captivating Presence
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the djinni must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the djinni for 1 minute or until the creature is farther than 30 feet away from it. On a successful save, the creature becomes immune to the djinni's Captivating Presence for 24 hours.

trait.name: Grant Wish (3/year)
entries: The djinni can grant a wish spell to a creature that isn't a genie. In order to work, the djinni must be willing to grant the wish. Unless carefully and properly worded, and if the djinni has good reason to, the djinni will pervert the wish's intent into a literal but undesirable or partial fulfillment. The djinni can't grant a wish purposely to serve its own needs.

trait.name: Elemental Demise
entries: If the djinni dies, its body disintegrates into crystalline powder, leaving behind only equipment the djinni was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The djinni has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The djinni makes three scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) lightning or thunder damage (djinni's choice) and the target can't take reactions until the end of the djinni's next turn.

action.name: Create Whirlwind
entries: A 10-foot-radius, 60-foot-tall cylinder of swirling air magically forms on a point the djinni can see within 120 feet of it. The whirlwind lasts as long as the djinni maintains concentration (as if concentrating on a spell). Any creature but the djinni that enters the whirlwind must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by it. The djinni can move the whirlwind up to 60 feet as an action, and creatures {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind move with it. The whirlwind ends if the djinni loses sight of it.

A creature can use its action to free a creature {@condition restrained} by the whirlwind, including itself, by succeeding on a {@dc 22} Strength check. If the check succeeds, the creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and moves to the nearest space outside the whirlwind.

legendary.name: Scimitar
entries: The djinni makes a scimitar attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The djinni casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The djinni magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Tornado Form (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The djinni magically transforms into a violent, twisting tornado and moves up to half its flying speed in a straight line and targets each creature its space it enters without provoking {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage, 9 ({@damage 2d8}) lightning damage, and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and is flung up 30 feet away from the djinni in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the damage and isn't
flung away or knocked {@condition prone}. The djinni reverts to its true form at the start of the next turn.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Maul

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If a target's saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Ruthless Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the dao can issue a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and can add a {@dice d10} to its roll provided it can understand the dao. A creature can beneft from only one ruthless command die at a time. This effect ends if the dao is {@condition incapacitated}.

entries: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fungus makes four Rotting Touch attacks.

action.name: Rotting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 8}). Until this grapple ends, the violet fungus can automatically hit the target with its Rotting Touch attacks, and the violet fungus can't use one of its Rotting Touch attacks against other targets.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the violet fungus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

action.name: Death Burst
entries: The shrieker explodes when it drops to 0 hit points. Each creature within 20 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage and become infected with a disease on a failed save. Creatures immune to the {@condition poisoned} condition are immune to this disease.

Le spore invadono il sistema di una creatura infetta, uccidendola in un numero di ore pari a {@dice 1d12} + il punteggio di Costituzione della creatura, a meno che la malattia non venga rimossa. Nella metà di questo tempo, la creatura diventa {@condition poisoned} per il resto della durata. Dopo la morte, la creatura germoglia {@dice 2d4} minuscole spore gassose che crescono a dismisura in 7 giorni.

reaction.name: Shriek
entries: When bright light or a creature is within 30 feet of the shrieker, it emits a shriek audible within 300 feet of it. The shrieker continues to shriek until the disturbance moves out of range and for {@dice 1d4} of the shrieker's turns afterward.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The phantom fungus is {@condition invisible} until it dies.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

trait.name: Invisibility
entries: The phantom fungus is {@condition invisible} until it dies.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The phantom fungus attacks three times: one with its bite and two with its tendrils.

action.name: Bite

If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is {@condition paralyzed}. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fomorian is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Painful Visions (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the fomorian targets each creature of its choice within 20 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fomorian attacks twice with its greatclub or makes one greatclub attack and uses Evil Eye once.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The fomorian magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 31 ({@damage 9d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity.
The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the fomorian can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fomorian attacks twice with its greatsword or makes one greatsword attack and uses Evil Eye once. It can use its Cleaving Swing in place of one of its greatsword attacks

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Evil Eye
entries: The fomorian magically forces a creature it can see within 60 feet of it to make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. The creature takes 27 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Cleaving Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: The fomorian swings its greataxe, and every creature within 15 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, a creature takes 28 ({@damage 6d6 + 7}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage.

action.name: Curse of the Evil Eye (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: With a stare, the fomorian uses Evil Eye, but on a failed save, the creature is also cursed with magical deformities. While deformed, the creature has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks, saving throws, and attacks based on Strength or Dexterity.
The transformed creature can repeat the saving throw whenever it finishes a long rest, ending the effect on a success.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The flameskull is an 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The flameskull sheds either dim light in a 15-foot radius, or bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for an additional 15 feet. It can switch between the options as an action.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The flameskull has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If the flameskull is destroyed, it regains all its hit points in 1 hour unless {@item holy water (flask)|phb|holy water} is sprinkled on its remains or {@spell dispel magic} or {@spell remove curse} spell is cast on them.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Fire Ray

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ettin is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Two Heads
entries: L'ettin ha vantaggio sulle prove di Saggezza ({@skill Perception}) e sui tiri salvezza contro l'essere {@condition blinded}, {@condition charmed}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition stunned} e l'essere colpito {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Two-Headed Battle Caster
entries: The ettin can cast a spell in place of one of its melee weapon attacks. In addition, it can maintain concentration on up to two spells. If the ettin casts a third spell that requires concentration while already maintaining concentraion on two other spells, one of the two previous spells ends (ettin's choice). If the ettin is required to make a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, it must make a separate saving throw for each spell.

trait.name: Wakeful
entries: When one of the ettin's heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ettin makes two melee weapon attacks, or it can make one melee weapon attack and cast a spell.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) danni da taglio.

action.name: Morningstar

entries: The ettin moves up to its walking speed and targets each creature within 5 feet of it during its movement. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw with disadvantage on the roll or take 24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) slashing damage. Until the start of its next turn, all attacks against the ettin have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The ettercap is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Summon Spiders (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the ettercap summons {@dice 3d4} giant wolf spiders or {@dice 1d6} giant spiders. The spiders appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the ettercap and acts as an ally of the ettercap. The spiders act right after the ettercap on the same initiative count and fght until they're destroyed. They disappear when the ettercap dies.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Woodland Strider
entries: Moving through nonmagical difficult terrain in a woodland environment doesn't cost the ettercap extra movement.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The ettercap makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws. It also uses Web if it is available.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Web {@recharge 4}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 13} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hit points, resistance to bludgeoning damage, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

reaction.name: Direct Spider Ally
entries: When a creature the ettercap can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the ettercap, the ettercap can target an allied spider it can see within 30 feet of the creature. The spider can use its reaction to move up to its speed and make one melee weapon attack at the creature.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 11}). The drow can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The drow can take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Skirmish Advantage
entries: The drow gains advantage on its first attack roll this turn if it has moved at least 15 feet from its space at the beginning of its turn.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drow has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drow makes two short sword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target is also {@condition unconscious} while {@condition poisoned} in this way. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

reaction.name: Skirmisher
entries: When an enemy the drow can see ends its turn within 5 feet of it, the drow can move up to half its speed. This movement doesn't provoke {@action opportunity attack|phb|opportunity attacks}.

The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

If the ally can see and hear the drow, it uses its reaction to make one melee weapon attack against the creature with advantage on the attack roll.

reaction.name: Lolth's Whispers (3/day)

entries: The drow can use an action to transform into a fiendish creature. Horns grow from her head, her skin turns leathery-red, bat-like wings sprout from her back, and her hands turn into vicious claws. While in this form, it gains 30 temporary hit points, resistance to cold, fire, lightning and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons, and immunity to poison. The effects last for 1 hour, or until the drow dies or uses a bonus action to end it.

headerEntries: The drow is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

entries: The drow has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow to sleep.

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The drow has 6 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Empowered Spell: When the drow rolls damage for a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to reroll up to 3 damage dice. It must use the new rolls. It can use Empowered Spell even if it has already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the drow casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the drow can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

If the saving throw is successful, the target is pushed out of the elemental's space.

At the start of each of the elemental's turns, each target {@condition grappled} by it takes 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental can pull a creature or object out of it by taking an action to make a {@dc 12} Strength and succeeding.

entries: The elemental sheds bright light in a 40-foot radius and dim light in an additional 40 feet.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Blast Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The fire elemental emits a searing wave of fire. Each creature within 15 feet of the fire elemental must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a creature fails its saving throw, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Earth Glide
entries: The elemental can burrow through nonmagical, unworked earth and stone. While doing so, the elemental doesn't disturb the material it moves through.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The elemental deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ground Smash {@recharge 5}
entries: The earth elemental slams the ground, triggering an earth tremor and violently pelting the area around it with debris. All other creatures on the ground within 15 feet of the earth elemental must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw, taking 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition prone} on a failed save, or half as much damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone} on a successful one.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Whirlwind {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in the elemental's space must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 10 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}.

If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 10} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Air Form
entries: The elemental can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Tornado {@recharge 4}
entries: The elemental magically transforms into a violent tornado and moves up to half its flying speed in a straight line and targets each creature its space it enters. Each target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 26 ({@damage 5d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and is flung up 30 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked {@condition prone}. The air elemental reverts to its true form at the end of the turn.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The duergar is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Duergar Resilience
entries: The duergar has advantage on saving throws against poison, spells, and illusions, as well as to resist being {@condition charmed} or {@condition paralyzed}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the duergar has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Wrath of Laduguer
entries: As a bonus action, when the duergar hits a creature with a weapon attack, it can expend a spell slot to deal {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage to the target, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of the duergar's next turn. If the duergar expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra necrotic damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each level above 1st (maximum {@dice 5d8}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The duergar makes two warhammer attacks and uses Enlarge if it is available.

action.name: Enlarge (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the duergar magically increases in size, along with anything it is wearing or carrying. While enlarged, the duergar is Large, doubles its damage dice on Strength-based weapon attacks (included in the attacks), and makes Strength checks and Strength saving throws with advantage. If the duergar lacks the room to become Large, it attains the maximum size possible in the space available.

action.name: Warhammer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage, or 11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage while enlarged.

action.name: Invisibility (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The duergar magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks, casts a spell, or uses its Enlarge, or until its concentration is broken, up to 1 hour (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the duergar wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The dryad can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dryad is a 15th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Agonizing Blast
entries: When the dryad casts eldritch blast, she adds her Charisma modifer to the damage it deals on a hit.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The dryad has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The dryad can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on her turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of her movement to step magically into one living tree within her reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@dice 1d6 + 2}) plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Fey Charm
entries: The dryad targets one humanoid or beast that she can see within 30 feet of her. If the target can see the dryad, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed}. The {@condition charmed} creature regards the dryad as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under the dryad's control, it takes the dryad's requests or actions in the most favorable way it can.

Each time the dryad or its allies do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 24 hours or until the dryad dies, is on a different plane of existence from the target, or ends the effect as a bonus action. If a target 's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the dryad's Fey Charm for the next 24 hours.
The dryad can have no more than one humanoid and up to three beasts {@condition charmed} at a time.

reaction.name: Misty Escape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: In response to taking damage, the dryad turns {@condition invisible} and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. It remains {@condition invisible} until the start of its next turn or until it attacks, makes a damage roll, or casts a spell.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drider's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). The drider can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drider is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It regains its expended spell slots when it finishes a short or long rest. It knows the following warlock spells:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The drider has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drider to sleep.

trait.name: Dark One's Own Luck (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When the drider makes an ability check or saving throw, it can add a {@dice d10} to the roll. It can do this after the roll is made but before any of the roll's effects occur.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Dagger

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The drider has 9 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Heightened Spell: When the drider casts a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the drider can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Quickened Spell: When the drider casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, the drider can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The doppelganger is a 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following bard spells prepared:

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form.
Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Dark Whispers
entries: The doppelganger can use a bonus action on its turn to target one creature within 30 feet of it. If the target can hear the doppelganger, the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the doppelganger by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the doppelganger, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends.

trait.name: Psychic Blades (3/day)
entries: The doppelganger deals an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Surprise Attack
entries: If the doppelganger surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 10 ({@dice 3d6}) damage from the attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doppelganger makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The doppelganger can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid it has seen, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form.
Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Ambusher
entries: The doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the doppelganger scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Cunning Action
entries: The doppelganger can take the {@action Dash}, {@action Disengage}, or {@action Hide} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the doppelganger is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the doppelganger instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The doppelganger deals an extra 17 ({@dice 5d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the doppelganger that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the doppelganger doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The doppelganger makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading its thoughts, as long as the doppelganger's concentration isn't broken (as if concentrating on a spell). While reading the target's mind, the doppelganger has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) and Charisma ({@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, and {@skill Persuasion}) checks against the target.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Stealthy
entries: On each of its turns, the displacer beast can use a bonus action to take the {@action Hide} action.

action.name: Displacement
entries: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

action.name: Slay Foe (1/Turn)
entries: The displacer beast deals an extra 9 ({@dice 2d8}) damage with its weapon attack if it hits a creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer beast makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the displacer beast is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Displacement
entries: The displacer beast projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The displacer beast has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the displacer beast's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Packmaster
entries: An allied displacer beast that starts its turn within 30 feet of this displacer beast and that can see and hear this displacer beast pack gains Pack Tactics until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The displacer beast pack lord makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its tentacles.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) danni perforanti.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The spinosaurus can hold its breath for up to 30 minutes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spinosaurus makes four attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, and one with its tail. It can't use its bite and tail attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 16}) . Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the spinosaurus can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} per colpire, portata 5 ft., un bersaglio. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) danni da taglio.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 3d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and if the attack roll against the target succeeds by 5 or higher, the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The mosasaurus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mosasaurus makes two attacks: one with its bite one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}47 ({@damage 6d12 + 8}) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}) . Until this grapple ends, the mosasarus can only bite the {@condition grappled} creature and has advantage on attack rolls to do so.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 3d12 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mosasaurus makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mosasaurus, and it takes 28 ({@damage 8d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the mosasaurus's turns. A mosasaurus can have only up to one Large, two Medium, or four Small creatures swallowed at a time.

If the mosasaurus takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the mosasaurus must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mosasaurus. If the mosasaurus dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spined devil scout's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). The spined devil scout can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The devil doesn't provoke an {@action opportunity attack} when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Limited Spines
entries: The devil has twelve tail spines. Used spines regrow by the time the devil finishes a long rest.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The spined devil scout deals an extra 7 ({@dice 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the spined devil scout that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the spined devil scout doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its fork or two with its tail spines.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fork
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Spine
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/80 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Pit Fiend Aristocrat's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw, unless the pit fiend is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. While {@condition frightened} in this way, a creature must take the {@action Dash} action and move away from the pit fiend by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move, in which case it needn't take the {@action Dash} action. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to the pit fiend, the creature can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends
If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the pit fiend's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The pit fiend's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pit fiend makes four attacks: one with its bite, one with its claw, one with its mace, and one with its tail. It can use its Fling in place of its claw attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d6 + 8}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned}. Until this poison ends, the target can't regain hit points, and it takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The {@condition poisoned} target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) slashing damage, and if the target is Large or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 18}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the pit fiend can automatically hit the target with its claw but can't make claw attacks against other targets.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) bludgeoning damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 8}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fling
entries: One Large or smaller object held or creature {@condition grappled} by the pit fiend is thrown up to 60 feet and knocked {@condition prone}. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Teleport
entries: The devil magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Hellfire Gaze {@recharge}
entries: The pit fiend's eyes projects intense fery energy in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw, taking 30 ({@damage 4d6 + 16}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, it is disintegrated. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fne ash and slag. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The pit fiend moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend makes a claw, mace, or tail attack.

legendary.name: Teleport (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The pit fiend casts a spell from its list of innate spells, using a spell slot as normal.

resist.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The devil' innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). It can innately cast the following spells, without providing material components:

trait.name: Aura of Chilling Frost
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the devil takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage and can't use reactions until the end of the devil's next turn.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede the devil's {@sense darkvision}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The devil has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The devil makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its ice spear, and one with its tail. It can use its Frost Ray in place of a melee attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Ice Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, or for 1 minute, its speed is reduced by 10 feet; it can take either an action or a bonus action on each of its turns, not both; and it can't take reactions. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Frost Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) cold damage.

action.name: Ruthless Command (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the devil can issue a telepathic command whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll. The creature takes {@damage 1d8} psychic damage and can add a {@dice d10} to its roll provided it can understand the devil. A creature can beneft from only one ruthless command die at a time. This effect ends if the devil is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Wall of Ice {@recharge}
entries: The devil magically forms an opaque wall of ice on a solid surface it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is 1 foot thick and up to 30 feet long and 10 feet high, or it's a hemispherical dome up to 20 feet in diameter.

When the wall appears, each creature in its space is pushed out of it by the shortest route. The creature chooses which side of the wall to end up on, unless the creature is {@condition incapacitated}. The creature then makes a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The wall lasts for 1 minute or until the devil is {@condition incapacitated} or dies.
